Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2010 05:43PM EZH wrote: kira:  I was about to post one word "XANAX".....but you beat me to it! Dearest ladies newly diagnosed and not yet staged:  when you mercifully, finally, (waiting is hell) get your surgery and get your nodes checked, you will have a lot more information.  Then, you and your onc. will come up with the game plan and then, trust me here, you will really feel sooo much better.  The panic will slowly subside and you'll do what needs to be done. And you will grow stronger and calmer.  Things will not ever be the same, but there will be a new, less panicky "normal".  My personal experience includes lumpectomy, bilateral mastectomy, offerectomy, chemo. and now Arimidex....some days are better than others but all days are better than the waiting and not knowing place that you all are in right now. It was hard for me to even breathe during that time. Sending you all warm hugs, and if I could send you each a Xanax, I would do that, too!
Posts.Title: "stress" symptoms--anyone else? calamtykel shells43

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2010 10:23PM EZH wrote: Granny-56:  I see that you posted 6 hours ago, have you re-posted in a more active place?  You may want to sign up with us, the ladies starting chemo in March 2010.  There is a group forming and we will all be going through the chemo together...come over!   Like you, I'll be starting chemo next week TC x 4 (3/2 start)...I've done a lot of reading on this site, you can read about the other ladies experiences in detail.  It takes some of the mystery out of what will happen, what to expect, things you can do to make side effects more manageable.   Hope you'll re-post on March 2010 Start strand and try reading the February 2010 strand and the What to Expect strands...  It is terrifying....but, it will also be okay!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo next week, granny-56 badger
